articles.title: Rajasthan cough syrup deaths: AAP protests outside pharma firm, seeks closure
articles.excerpt: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Saturday held a protest in Jaipur, demanding the closure of city-based Kaysons Pharma, a pharmaceutical firm involved in manufacturing cough syrups that are under the scanner for reportedly causing two child deaths in the state. The AAP agitation came days after the state Medical and Health Department halted the supply of all 19 medicines manufactured by Kaysons Pharma, along with all other syrups containing dextromethorphan, until further orders. On Saturday, AAP workers were seen holding a protest outside Kaysons Pharma amid reports that two children died after allegedly consuming cough syrup manufactured by the firm in Rajasthan’s Sikar district..

articles.title: Hold Bihar election soon after Chhath, in single phase: Parties urge poll body
articles.excerpt: Political parties in Bihar on Saturday urged the Election Commission of India (ECI) to schedule the state Assembly elections immediately after the Chhath festival, which falls on October 28 this year. Parties also recommended that the elections be conducted in the minimum possible phases to ensure smoother voting and counting.ECI MEETING WITH POLITICAL PARTIES The Commission interacted with representatives of recognised national and state parties, including the Aam Aadmi Party, Bahujan Samaj Party, Bharatiya Janata Party, Communist Party of India (Marxist), Indian National Congress, National People's Party, CPI(ML) Liberation, Janata Dal (United), Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas), Rashtriya Janata Dal, and Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party. During the discussions, parties emphasised holding elections immediately after Chhath and completing the process in as few phases as possible.HOLD ASSEMBLY ELECTIONS IN A SINGLE PHASE: JD(U).

articles.title: PM Modi to inaugurate Rs 19,647 crore Navi Mumbai airport on October 8
articles.excerpt: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first phase of the Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) on October 8, a senior Maharashtra government official confirmed on Saturday. The state-of-the-art greenfield airport has been built at a cost of Rs 19,647 crore and will mark the second major airport in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region after the existing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport. The commercial flight operations from Navi Mumbai Airport are expected to begin in December.

articles.title: UK PM Keir Starmer to make first official visit to India next week
articles.excerpt: The United Kingdom’s Prime Minister, Keir Starmer, will make his first official visit to India on October 8-9, 2025, at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) announced.INDIA-UK STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP IN FOCUS During the two-day visit, the two leaders are expected to review progress under the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership through the ‘Vision 2035’ roadmap, a 10-year plan covering trade and investment, technology and innovation, defence and security, climate and energy, health, education, and people-to-people ties. On October 9 in Mumbai, Modi and Starmer will engage with business and industry leaders to explore opportunities presented by the India–UK Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA). The discussions will also cover issues of regional and global importance.

articles.title: 2 killed in suspected methane explosion at UP coaching centre
articles.excerpt: At least two people were killed and seven others injured in an explosion at a coaching centre in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad on Saturday. The blast likely occurred due to excessive concentrated methane in the septic tank located in the coaching centre's basement, police said. Methane is a highly flammable gas and its accumulation in confined spaces such as septic tanks can pose a significant risk if not properly ventilated.

articles.title: Layoff News: Carmaker Renault plans to cut 3,000 jobs through voluntary redundancy offer, says report | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: French carmaker Renault is reportedly planning to lay off 3,000 employees worldwide, primarily in support roles through a voluntary redundancy program — an offer where staff can choose to leave the company in exchange for a financial package, instead of being directly laid off. The final decision on the lay off is expected to be made by the end of the year, reported French newsletter L'Informe. The job cuts are part of an internal cost savings initiative dubbed “Arrow,” under which Renault aims to reduce its workforce in support services such as human resources, finance and marketing by 15 per cent..

articles.title: Pak asks Trump to develop port on Arabian Sea, close to India's Chabahar
articles.excerpt: Pakistan has dangled an offer before US President Donald Trump to build and run a port on the Arabian Sea as it seeks to warm up to America amid a reset in ties, according to a report in the Financial Times. The civilian port will be located in Pasni, a town in Balochistan's Gwadar district, placing it strategically close to the Chabahar port being developed by India in Iran. The report said advisers to Pakistani army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir have approached top US officials with the offer, valued at up to $1.2 billion.DEEP-WATER PORT IN PASNI As per the blueprint, the US would build and operate a terminal at the port to access Pakistan's critical minerals in Pasni.

articles.title: Pak blinks as it signs deal with POK protesters, calls it victory of peace

Even though the Shehbaz Sharif-led government succumbed to pressure, it called the deal "a victory for peace", a face-saving gesture. articles.title: Iran executes seven over killings of security forces, cleric
articles.excerpt: Iran on Saturday executed seven men convicted of killing security personnel and a cleric several years ago, the judiciary’s news agency Mizan reported. Six of the men were ethnic Arab separatists accused of carrying out armed attacks and bombings in Khorramshahr, in the southwestern province of Khuzestan, that killed four security forces. The seventh, Saman Mohammadi Khiyareh, a Kurd, was convicted over the 2009 assassination of Mamousta Sheikh al-Islam, a pro-government Sunni cleric in the Kurdish city of Sanandaj.

articles.title: 7 youths injured in knife attack during Durga idol immersion in Jharkhand
articles.excerpt: Seven youths were injured, one of them critically, in a stabbing incident during a Durga idol immersion ceremony in Jharkhand. The incident happened on Friday night when a group of youths from the Harijan Basti area in Chakradharpur were returning after immersing the idol of their Durga Puja pandal. As they were returning, a group of 15 assailants entered the procession and went on a stabbing spree.

articles.title: BJP, Shinde Sena and Uddhav Thackeray spar over ‘fake Hindutva’ ahead of Mumbai civic polls
articles.excerpt: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray’s recent Dussehra rally speech, in which he accused the BJP of promoting “fake Hindutva” and questioned its commitment to Hindu values, has triggered a sharp political exchange ahead of the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections. Thackeray’s remarks, which targeted the BJP’s “contradictory” stance on Hindu-Muslim issues and its alliance with the Eknath Shinde-led faction, drew quick responses from leaders of the ruling alliance. BJP leader and Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule hit back at Thackeray, criticising him for aligning with the Congress party which, he claimed, “insults Veer Savarkar.” He questioned why Thackeray refrained from criticising the Congress during his Dussehra speech, saying the former chief minister had “abandoned his father’s ideology by sitting in the lap of Congress.”.

articles.title: Srinagar Police attaches property worth Rs 2 crore linked to terrorist's family
articles.excerpt: The Srinagar Police on Saturday attached a three-storey house worth around Rs 2 crore belonging to the family of designated terrorist Sajad Ahmad Sheikh alias Sajad Gul, in a move aimed at dismantling terror networks and their financial structures. The property, built on 15 marlas of land at Rose Avenue in HMT, Khushipora, is registered in the name of Gul’s father, Ghulam Mohammad Sheikh, according to revenue records verified by officials in Srinagar. articles.title: Not 'Rule Of Bulldozer': CJI Gavai Says India Governed By Rule Of Law, Cites His Own Ruling
articles.excerpt: Chief Justice of India (CJI) BR Gavai said that the foundation of the Indian republic rests firmly on the rule of law and not on the “rule of the bulldozer." Delivering the inaugural Sir Maurice Rault Memorial Lecture 2025 on ‘Rule of Law in the Largest Democracy’ in Mauritius, Justice BR Gavai stressed that India’s legal system cannot permit the executive to assume the roles of “judge, jury and executioner." “The judgment sent a clear message that the Indian legal system is governed by the rule of law, not by the rule of the bulldozer," Justice BR Gavai said, recalling the Supreme Court’s own ruling that decried “bulldozer justice"- a practice that has come to symbolise the demolition of homes of accused persons without due process. The Supreme Court, he reminded, had earlier held that such demolitions bypass legal processes, infringe on the fundamental right to shelter under Article 21 and violate the principle of rule of law. “It was further held that the executive cannot assume the roles of judge, jury, and executioner simultaneously," he noted, quoting from the verdict.

articles.title: Out On Morning Walk, 3 Ghaziabad Women Killed As Speeding Car Rams Into Them | Video
articles.excerpt: A morning walk turned tragic when a speeding car rammed into four pedestrians in Ghaziabad’s Sihani Gate area, killing three women and leaving a man critically injured, police said. The accident took place around 5.45 am on Rakesh Marg along GT Road, when the victims- all residents of New Kotagaon- were out for their daily walk. CCTV footage of the incident shows the three women, dressed in salwar kameez, crossing the road with a man when a white car suddenly ploughed into them before crashing into the divider.

articles.title: Blast At Farrukhabad Coaching Centre Leaves Two Dead, Several Students Injured
articles.excerpt: Two students were killed and at least 10 others injured after a powerful explosion ripped through a coaching centre near Satanpur mandi in Farrukhabad district, police said. The blast took place around 11 am in the Kadri Gate police station area, reducing the building to rubble and injuring those present inside, officials said. The injured have been shifted to nearby hospitals, where doctors confirmed two deaths.

articles.title: Was Zubeen Garg’s Death Tied To Financial Dispute With Manager? Assam CID Probes
articles.excerpt: The shocking and untimely death of legendary Assamese singer Zubeen Garg has taken an unexpected and disturbing turn, with CID Assam probing a possible financial motive behind his death. The probe team is investigating that financial pressure could be one of the reasons that led to Garg’s death under mysterious circumstances. One of the key aspects under probe is the nature of Zubeen’s financial dealings and whether any tensions erupted between him and his manager, Siddharth Sharma, over financial matters.

articles.title: UK PM Keir Starmer To Visit India Next Week; Hold Talks With PM Modi On Trade, Security
articles.excerpt: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will make his first official visit to India on October 8–9 at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the Ministry of External Affairs said. During the two-day visit, Keir Starmer and PM Modi will review progress under the India–UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership in line with Vision 2035. Discussions will cover trade, investment, technology, defence, climate, energy, health and education.

articles.excerpt: Zerodha founder and CEO Nithin Kamath has warned that a continuation of the ongoing stock market headwinds may force his brokerage house, which has long pioneered a free platform for its millions of users, may have to start charging fees. articles.title: The Big AI Trade in Europe Is All About Data Centers and Power | Mint
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- As the artificial intelligence frenzy drives global equities to record highs, in Europe the momentum is flowing into industries critical to powering the technology. A basket tracking shares of 10 European firms such as data center operators and infrastructure providers has rallied 23% this year, beating a 12% advance in the Stoxx Europe 600 Index and even outperforming the Nasdaq 100, home to the US tech heavyweights. While that’s a far cry from the 69% boom in US power stocks, investors including BlackRock Inc., JPMorgan Asset Management and Ninety One Plc are betting the European names can close the gap as they benefit from hundreds of billions of dollars in global AI spending..

articles.title: WhatsApp may soon add @username handles, moving beyond phone numbers | Mint
articles.excerpt: WhatsApp is reportedly preparing to introduce a long-anticipated update that will allow users to create usernames, moving away from its long-standing reliance on phone numbers. Since its launch in 2009, the Meta-owned messaging platform has only enabled registration and contact discovery through mobile numbers, a system that has increasingly looked dated compared with competitors such as Telegram, which has offered usernames for years. The upcoming feature has been spotted in recent test builds of the app, where references to usernames and their rules were uncovered.

articles.title: Israel strikes kill 6 in Gaza hours after Trump calls for end to bombardment
articles.excerpt: Israel carried out fresh strikes in Gaza on Saturday, killing six people just hours after US President Donald Trump directed an end to the bombardment and announced that Hamas was ready for peace. According to local authorities, one Israeli strike hit a house in Gaza City, killing four people, while another strike in Khan Younis, in southern Gaza, killed two others. The attacks came shortly after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office said Israel was preparing for an “immediate implementation” of the first stage of Trump’s Gaza plan, which involves the release of Israeli hostages following Hamas’ response.

articles.title: Karur stampede: Police to seize actor Vijay's campaign bus used during incident
articles.excerpt: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) constituted by the Madras High Court will seize the bus used by actor and Tamilaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK) founder Vijay during his September 27 political rally in Karur, Tamil Nadu, which left 41 people dead and more than 60 injured, sources told India Today TV. articles.title: India IT Sector To Grow 4-5% Despite Global Challenges: HSBC
articles.excerpt: India’s IT sector may see a growth in the range of 4-5 per cent in the long run, above the trendline of the past three years, according to a report of HSBC Global Investment Research. Analysts assumed less macro volatility in the coming quarters and expected some recovery in growth in FY27, the report from HSBC Global Investment Research said. The IT services sector is expected to remain sluggish in Q2 FY26, as demand continues to be muted amid macroeconomic uncertainties and the deflationary effects of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Bajaj Scion’s Nephew Acquires Luxury Alibaug Home At Rs 38.15 Crore: Report
articles.excerpt: Anurang Jain, promoter of Endurance Technologies and nephew of the late Bajaj Auto scion Rahul Bajaj, has acquired a luxury villa in Alibaug, near Mumbai, for ₹38.15 crore, according to Hindustan Times citing property registration records accessed by Zapkey.com. The transaction was officially registered on September 23, 2025. For this purchase, Jain paid a stamp duty of ₹1.33 crore and a registration fee of ₹30,000.

articles.title: Asom Gana Parishad Writes To PM Modi, Seeks Bharat Ratna For Late Zubeen Garg
articles.excerpt: Assam Minister and Asom Gana Parishad leader Atul Bora said on Saturday that his party has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, seeking the Bharat Ratna for late singer Zubeen Garg. The AGP has also called for a high-level inquiry into the death of Zubeen Garg in Singapore, which triggered an outpouring of grief in Assam. Widely regarded as a cultural icon and voice of the Assamese people, Zubeen’s sudden passing was met with shock and sorrow from his fans and public figures.

articles.title: 'India Will Cross Any Border To Protect Its Integrity, Citizens': Rajnath Singh
articles.excerpt: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has asserted that India will never compromise whenever its pride and dignity are at stake and can cross any border whenever necessary to protect its citizens and safeguard India’s unity and integrity. Citing the 2016 surgical strike, 2019 Balakot airstrike and the recent Operation Sindoor, the Union Minister said that the NDA government had shown its readiness to take decisive action when the protection of India’s citizens and integrity were at stake, news agency PTI reported. "When it comes to India’s glory and dignity, we never compromised.

articles.title: Japan likely to get its first female PM as Sanae Takaichi wins leadership vote
articles.excerpt: Sanae Takaichi emerged victorious in Japan's ruling party leadership race on Saturday, a contest dominated by male rivals, positioning her to become the country's first female prime minister and follow in the footsteps of her idol, Margaret Thatcher. Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party elected Takaichi (64) to rebuild public trust eroded by soaring prices and growing support for opposition parties vowing massive stimulus and tougher immigration controls. "Rather than being happy, I feel like the tough work starts here," Takaichi told fellow LDP lawmakers following her win..

articles.title: No posters, no rallies, no debates: Many Syrians unaware of parliamentary election since Assad's fall
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like The streets of Damascus barely showed sign Saturday a parliamentary election was set to take place the next day. There were no candidate posters on the main streets and squares, no rallies, or public debates. In the days leading up to the polling, some residents of the Syrian capital had no idea a vote was hours away, the first since Islamic insurgents ousted former President Bashar Assad in a lightning offensive in December..

articles.title: What Is Diethylene Glycol, Highly Toxic Chemical Found In 'Coldrif' Syrup In Tamil Nadu?
articles.excerpt: The Tamil Nadu government on Friday banned the sale of the ‘Coldrif’ cough syrup and ordered its removal from all markets after it was linked to the deaths of 11 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. Lab tests found the syrup contained diethylene glycol (DEG), a deadly chemical that can cause kidney failure and death. The sale was prohibited across the state with effect from October 1, as inspections were conducted at the Tamil Nadu-based Sresan Pharma’s manufacturing facility in Sunguvarchathram.
articles.content_snippet: The Tamil Nadu government on Friday banned the sale of the ‘Coldrif’ cough syrup and ordered its removal from all markets after it was linked to the deaths of 11 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. articles.title: 3 women, out on morning walk, killed after car crushes them in UP; driver flees
articles.excerpt: Three women were killed, and a man was seriously injured after a speeding car hit them during their morning walk in Ghaziabad today. According to police, the incident took place around 6 am near the Rakesh Marg cut on GT Road, where an over-speeding car rammed into four morning walkers. The victims have been identified as Vipin Sharma (47), a resident of Shtam Vihar Colony, and Meenu Prajapati (56), Kamlesh (55), and Savitri Devi (60), all residents of New Kotgaon in the Kotwali area..
articles.content_snippet: Three women were killed, and a man was seriously injured after a speeding car hit them during their morning walk in Ghaziabad today. The victims have been identified as Vipin Sharma (47), a resident of Shtam Vihar Colony, and Meenu Prajapati (56), Kamlesh (55), and Savitri Devi (60), all residents of New Kotgaon in the Kotwali area.

articles.title: Massive fire breaks out at oil refinery in California, flames visible for miles
articles.excerpt: A massive fire broke out at the Chevron oil refinery in El Segundo, California, on Thursday night, sending towering flames into the sky that were visible for miles. By early Friday, officials said the blaze had been contained with no threat to public safety. Residents were urged to remain indoors as a precaution, but no evacuations were ordered.

articles.title: India, Bhutan Hold Talks On Trade, Connectivity And People-To-People Ties
articles.excerpt: India’s Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri met Bhutan’s PM, King, and Foreign Minister, discussing connectivity, hydropower, trade, and bilateral ties, reaffirming India-Bhutan’s unique friendship based on trust, cooperation, and regular high-level exchanges. Trending Photos India's Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri held talks with Bhutan's Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay on Friday and discussed a wide range of issues, including connectivity and hydropower. Prime Minister Tobgay, in a social media post, said he was "pleased to meet Vikram Misri" and highlighted the wide range of issues discussed, including connectivity, hydropower cooperation, trade and commerce, and people-to-people relations.

articles.title: Multidisciplinary Team Probing To Assess Cause Of Cough Syrup Deaths In MP, Rajasthan: Govt
articles.excerpt: A probe undertaken by the Tamil Nadu FDA at the behest of the MP government, it was found that the cough syrups contained DEG beyond the permissible limits. Trending Photos NEW DELHI: After detecting highly toxic chemical diethylene glycol (DEG) in samples of cough syrups manufactured by Tamil Nadu-based drug manufacturer, the Union government has informed that a multidisciplinary team comprising experts from central agencies such as NIV, ICMR, and CDSCO are probing to assess the cause of deaths in children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. About nine children have in recent weeks succumbed to death in MP's Chhindwara, and two children died in Rajasthan -- one in Bharatpur and another in Sikar after consuming counterfeit cough syrup in Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh due to suspected kidney failure.

articles.title: 63-Year-Old Lawyer In Mumbai Blackmailed With Nude Video After Spa Visit, Loses Rs 50,000
articles.excerpt: A 63-year-old lawyer in Mumbai’s Borivali was allegedly blackmailed and assaulted by two men who filmed him in a compromising position during a massage session. The accused, who posed as masseurs, initially extorted Rs 50,000 and later demanded an additional Rs 6 lakh, police said on Friday. According to investigators, the incident came to light when the complainant, a lawyer who had recently purchased a vacant flat in Borivali, searched for a massage service through an online Yellow Pages directory in July this year.

articles.title: Pakistan High Commission Visa Desk In Delhi Misused As ISI Recruitment Hub | Exclusive
articles.excerpt: Top intelligence sources have exclusively confirmed to CNN-News18 that the Visa Section of the Pakistan High Commission (PHC) in New Delhi is being systematically misused as a hub for espionage, functioning as a “soft entry point" to identify, recruit, and groom vulnerable Indian nationals for intelligence work. The latest confirmation of this modus operandi comes with the September 30 arrest of Waseem Akram, a civil engineer from Palwal, under the Official Secrets Act (OSA) and the new Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS). Akram was acting as a courier and data supplier for PHC official Jaffar, alias Muzammil Hussain.

articles.title: Flash flood alert in Bihar after four days of relentless rainfall
articles.excerpt: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a flash flood alert for several districts in Bihar for today and tomorrow, following four consecutive days of incessant rainfall that has severely disrupted normal life across the state. The districts under the flash flood alert include - Patna, Bhabua, Arwal, Bhojpur, Buxar, Rohtas, Saran, Siwan, Araria, Banka, Begusarai, Bhagalpur, Darbhanga, Gaya, Jamui, Khagaria, Lakhisarai, Madhepura, Madhubani, Munger, Nawada, West Champaran, East Champaran, Purnia, Saharsa, Samastipur, Shivhar, Sitamarhi, and Vaishali. According to reports from Sasaram, relentless rain from late Friday night until 3 am Saturday has submerged the entire city and surrounding areas.

articles.title: Gujarat ATS seizes ₹30 crore Mephedrone in Daman; one arrested, two absconding
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like Ahmedabad: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) and Daman police arrested a history-sheeter and seized 5.9 kg of mephedrone worth ₹30 crore after raiding a clandestine factory in Daman, a Union Territory, and a storage facility in Gujarat’s Vapi, police said on Friday. Mohan Narayanlal Paliwal, a known offender, was arrested during Thursday’s raid, while two others — Mehul Thakur and Vivek Balendra Rai — remain at large, a police officer said, adding that all three are residents of Vapi in Valsad district. “During the raid, authorities disrupted an active mephedrone production process at the Daman farmhouse, seizing 5.9 kg of mephedrone in solid and liquid forms from the Vapi bungalow, along with 300 kg of raw materials and equipment like grinders, motors, glass flasks, and heaters,” an officer said..

articles.title: Trouble brewing: Maya people in Yucatán fear new Heineken plant’s thirst for water
articles.excerpt: Indigenous groups in Mexico opposed to the planned brewery say families already have little access to water – and that their way of life is also under threat On a summer evening in southern Mexico, a percussion group using water bottles as instruments leads a procession through Mérida, capital of Yucatán state. Children walking alongside elderly people are guided by members of Múuch’ Xíinbal, a Maya land rights organisation. The placards they carry declare: “Water is not for sale.” A heavy chant accompanies the march: “It’s not a drought – it’s plunder!” At a rallying point in the city, protesters read from a manifesto and accuse the government of prioritising profit over water, health and land.

articles.title: Gold prices rally for the seventh straight week on US shutdown, US Fed rate cut buzz. Will the rally continue? | Stock Market News
articles.excerpt: Gold rate today: Following the safe-haven demand for precious metals after the US shutdown, which fueled optimism for a US Fed rate cut, gold prices extended their rally for the seventh straight week. The MCX gold rate finished at ₹1,18,100 per 10 grams, logging a weekly gain of 2.79%. Before settling above the ₹18,000 level, MCX gold rate climbed to a new peak of ₹1,18,444 per 10 gm as well.

articles.title: Data breach alert: Hackers claim 1bn Salesforce records stolen via UK retailer attacks – Who they are, what’s at risk? | Mint
articles.excerpt: Cybercriminals linked to a wave of ransomware incidents targeting British retailers have claimed responsibility for stealing almost one billion records from US cloud technology giant Salesforce. The group, calling itself Scattered LAPSUS$ Hunters, told Reuters on Friday that it had obtained vast troves of personal information by exploiting companies that rely on Salesforce software. The group, an apparent offshoot of the wider LAPSUS$ cybercrime network, said it was behind recent breaches at Marks & Spencer, the Co-op and Jaguar Land Rover earlier this year.

articles.title: Cyclone Shakhti: Who Named The Storm, And How It May Affect Gujarat And Maharashtra
articles.excerpt: The country’s weather scenario is set to worsen as the first cyclonic storm in the post-monsoon season, Cyclone Shakhti, has intensified over the Arabian Sea. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has confirmed that the cyclone, which originated in the northeast Arabian Sea, has strengthened into a severe cyclonic storm, prompting coastal regions to brace for heavy rainfall and strong winds. According to the IMD, Cyclone Shakhti is currently situated approximately 270 km southwest of Naliya in Gujarat, 300 km west of Porbandar, and 360 km south of Karachi, Pakistan.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu Regulator Warns Against Use Of Coldrif Syrup After Lab Detects Deadly Diethylene Glycol
articles.excerpt: The Tamil Nadu Drugs Control Department has issued a public alert warning against the use of Coldrif Syrup manufactured by Sresan Pharmaceutical, after laboratory tests confirmed that the product was adulterated with diethylene glycol (DEG)—a highly toxic chemical known to cause kidney failure and death. The alert follows investigations into the deaths of around 11 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan, which were initially suspected to be linked to the consumption of the same cough syrup. On October 4, the Union health ministry also confirmed that samples of Coldrif Syrup collected from the manufacturer’s premises in Tamil Nadu contained DEG beyond permissible limits.
articles.content_snippet: The Tamil Nadu Drugs Control Department has issued a public alert warning against the use of Coldrif Syrup manufactured by Sresan Pharmaceutical, after laboratory tests confirmed that the product was adulterated with diethylene glycol (DEG)—a highly toxic chemical known to cause kidney failure and death. The alert follows investigations into the deaths of around 11 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan, which were initially suspected to be linked to the consumption of the same cough syrup. On...

articles.title: French Carmaker Renault Mulls Cutting 3,000 Jobs In Support Services Amid Sales Pressure: Report
articles.excerpt: Renault Layoffs: French carmaker Renault SA is mulling plans to reduce the workforce by as many as 3,000 employees worldwide in support services such as human resources, finance and marketing, according to French news site l’informe. It will be around 15 per cent of the total workforce of the carmaker. Renault told AFP that it was considering ways to simplify operations, speed up execution and optimise fixed costs.

articles.title: New York’s Roosevelt Hotel May Make Way for New Skyscraper
articles.excerpt: Source: Plexi Images/Universal Images Group Editorial/Getty Images Pakistan is considering options for the Roosevelt Hotel in Midtown Manhattan as part of the South Asian nation’s efforts to meet its commitments to the International Monetary Fund. One of the options is to raze the storied landmark and build a skyscraper in its place, said Muhammad Ali, adviser to the prime minister on privatization. The government is keen on a joint venture where Pakistan will contribute the land and the partner will bring in the equity, he told Bloomberg in Islamabad..

articles.title: Is Zerodha Set To End Free Equity Delivery? Nikhil Kamath Flags Revenue Pressure

articles.title: IMF Says Talks on New Senegal Program Will Start Mid-October
articles.excerpt: Downtown Dakar, Senegal. The International Monetary Fund will begin talks with Senegal on a new program in mid-October, Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said following a board meeting on the country’s debt misreporting. The meeting, a key step in concluding a nearly year-long review of the West African nation’s finances, follows initial discussions on the broad framework of a new program held with Senegalese authorities in Dakar in August, Georgieva said in a statement late Friday..

articles.title: October 4, 1977: 48 Years On, Atal Bihari Vajpayee's First Hindi Speech At UN Still Revered
articles.excerpt: The corridors of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), long dominated by English and French, reverberated with Hindi for the very first time on this day in 1977. The voice was that of Atal Bihari Vajpayee, then External Affairs Minister in the Morarji Desai-led Janata Party government, who later went on to become the Prime Minister. His speech, delivered in Hindi at the 32nd session of the UN General Assembly on October 4, 1977, not only set a precedent but also showcased India’s cultural confidence before the world.

articles.title: Centre Confirms DEG Contamination In Madhya Pradesh Cough Syrup Samples Amid Probe Into Child Deaths
articles.excerpt: The Union government has confirmed the presence of diethylene glycol (DEG) much beyond permissible limits in cough syrup samples manufactured by Sresan Pharmaceutical, marking a sharp shift from its statement a day before that no DEG was found in syrups linked to child deaths in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. News18 first reported the sharp contrast between the results of Tamil Nadu’s drug regulator finding toxic DEG in samples while the Centre refused the presence of any harmful contaminants in the syrups. According to a press note shared by the Union ministry of health and family welfare on Saturday morning, the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) tested six syrup samples collected as part of the probe, and all six were found to be free of DEG/EG.

articles.title: 'We Stand With You': Days After Karur Stampede, Posters Backing TVK Chief Vijay Seen In Tamil Nadu
articles.excerpt: Days after a stampede at TVK founder Vijay’s political rally in Karur claimed the lives of 41 people, posters supporting the actor were seen in some cities of Tamil Nadu. “Save the Commander. We will restore Tamil Nadu," one of the posters displayed on a locked grill gate in Viluppuram read.
articles.content_snippet: Days after a stampede at TVK founder Vijay’s political rally in Karur claimed the lives of 41 people, posters supporting the actor were seen in some cities of Tamil Nadu. “Save the Commander. articles.title: India Sends Letter To UK Assuring Nirav Modi Will Only Face Trial, No Questioning: Report
articles.excerpt: India sent a letter of assurance to the United Kingdom where it said that if fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi is extradited to India, he will not be “interrogated or taken into custody by any agency" and “will only face trial" on his return. The letter also highlighted that India expects the court which accepted a plea from Nirav Modi seeking to reopen his extradition proceeding dismiss Nirav Modi’s plea at the first hearing itself on the basis of this letter. It also mentions that Nirav Modi will be housed in Arthur Road prison in Mumbai where living conditions for inmates are better.

articles.title: Rs 8.85 Lakh Loan Scam: 5 Money Lessons Every Investor Should Know
articles.excerpt: A middle-class man in Rajkot, Gujarat, fell victim to a fraud worth Rs 8.85 lakh by an individual who promised to secure his loan approvals. According to the Times of India, after receiving loan approval messages via WhatsApp, the man transferred Rs 9.35 lakh to the fraudster’s bank account as a processing fee and login charge. He later realised he had been cheated when no loan amount was disbursed, and he only received a refund of Rs 50,000.
